IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Maryvale's mission, inspired by the compassionate service of our Vincential Founders, faithful to Catholic Social Teaching rooted in the gospel of Jesus Christ and the charism of the Daughters of Charity, is to heal, empower and educate children and families in order to instill hope for a more fulfilling future. We do this by providing residential, educational, mental health and community-based services in an environment of dignity, love and respect.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Maryvale's mission, inspired by the compassionate service of our Vincentian Founders, faithful to Catholic Social Teaching rooted in the gospel of Jesus Christ and the charism of the Daughters of Charity, is to heal,(See Schedule O for full Mission Statement) empower and educate children and families in order to instill hope for a more fulfilling future. We do this by providing residential, educational, mental health and community-based services in an environment of dignity, love and respect.
IRS990.Desc: Residential Treatment - Maryvale cares for abused, abandoned and neglected children in the foster care and probation system. This program helps children heal from past trauma through intensive mental health services and care that addresses physical, emotional and sexual abuse. During the period covered, this program provided 23,439 days of service to 237 girls and boys ages 6 to 18.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Early Education - Maryvale's two Early Education Centers provide learning curriculums that nurture and stimulate active and curious preschoolers. It instills a love lifelong learning and provides a foundation for future academic success. During the period covered, this program provided services to 414 children.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Mental Health -Along with providing mental health services to the children in its residential treatment program, Maryvale provides mental health support for children and families in the community. These services offered to at-risk youth/families include therapy, parenting education, community resource referrals and other services to provide the family with tailored mental health and support care.During the period covered, this program provided services to 517 clients.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Permanently restricted net assets represent contributions which the donor has stipulated that the principal is to be kept intact in perpetuity and only the interest and dividends there from may be expended for unrestricted purposes. The donors have stipulated that the principal is to be kept intact in perpetuity and that the interest and dividends therefrom may be expended for educational purposes only.

Maryvale is exempt from taxation under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and California Revenue and Taxation Code Section 23701d. Generally accepted accounting principles provide accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by Maryvale in its federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. Maryvale's returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years, respectively, after they are filed.
Maryvale disburses assistance to individuals based on eligibility and need.
Number of donations are based on the number of contributors

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A copy of the Form 990 was provided to each member of the Board of Directors electronically by the President/Executive Director prior to submission to the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Annually, each member of the Board of Directors is required to sign a Conflict of Interest Statement which delineates the specific responsibilities in this area. Compliance is monitored on a regular basis to ensure that members do not vote on any action which may create a conflict of interest or even give the appearance of a conflict of interest. Also, members are required to report any apparent conflicts of interest.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Board of Directors is responsible for determining the compensation for the President/Executive Director and Head of Finance. The process for determining compensation shall include comparability data and contemporaneous substantiation of the deliberation and decision. The Board of Directors may delegate the groundwork for this review to be conducted by an ad-hoc subcommittee of the Board; however, the final decision will be approved by the full Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Agency makes its audited financials and Form 990 available to the public upon written request to the President/Executive Director.
